meanings.definition: A broadcast in which the colors are distorted or unnatural.
meanings.sent1: The colorcast on the TV made everything look strange.
meanings.sent2: The colorcast of the movie was off, making the actors appear different.
meanings.sent3: The colorcast on the screen turned the characters into funny cartoon versions.
meanings.sent4: The colorcast of the painting gave it an eerie, otherworldly feel.
meanings.sent5: The colorcast in the room created a dream-like atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To give a distorted or unnatural color to (a photograph or television image).
meanings.sent1: She accidentally colorcast the photo, making it look unrealistic.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to colorcast the painting to enhance its mood.
meanings.sent3: He colorcasted the image, turning the sky purple and the grass blue.
meanings.sent4: The lighting in the room colorcast everything in a warm, golden hue.
meanings.sent5: The filter she used colorcasted the scene in a vintage style.
